solution_line_template: Lee currently earns ${annual_salary} / {months_per_year} months = $<<{annual_salary}/{months_per_year}={monthly_salary}>>{monthly_salary} per month.
The engagement ring will cost him {months_salary_for_ring} * ${monthly_salary} = $<<{months_salary_for_ring}*{monthly_salary}={ring_cost}>>{ring_cost}.
This means that it will take Lee ${ring_cost} / ${monthly_savings} = <<{ring_cost}/{monthly_savings}={time_to_save_months}>>{time_to_save_months} months to save enough money before he can propose.
